title: Adam Shatz: The World since 7 October
summary: The inability of Western powers to condemn Israel’s conduct – much less bring it to an end – has made a mockery of the rules-based order that they claim to uphold.
fullContent: The inability of Western powers to condemn Israel’s conduct – much less bring it to an end – has made a mockery of the rules-based order that they claim to uphold.

title: Becca Rothfeld: Whatevership
summary: Tulathimutte recognises that the internet has all the elements of great fiction: Talmudic feats of interpretation, endless layers of intertextual reference, reposts and ripostes, the subtle slights that are the stuff of the novel of manners (the soft block v. the mute!
fullContent: Tulathimutte recognises that the internet has all the elements of great fiction: Talmudic feats of interpretation, endless layers of intertextual reference, reposts and ripostes, the subtle slights that are the stuff of the novel of manners (the soft block v. the mute!), genres with distinctive requirements, triumphs of lunatic self-fashioning.

title: Jackson Lears: The Righteous Community
summary: There are many reasons war fever has raged out of control, but the millenarian worldview contributed to igniting the conflagration. How else can we explain the compulsion to repeat failed strategies time after time, still less the willingness to destroy the entire world,...
fullContent: There are many reasons war fever has raged out of control, but the millenarian worldview contributed to igniting the conflagration. How else can we explain the compulsion to repeat failed strategies time after time, still less the willingness to destroy the entire world, oneself included, to fulfil what one believes is a divinely ordained purpose?

title: David Trotter: Putt for Dough
summary: Golf lends itself to spectacle. There’s a special thrill to the shape of the perfectly hit shot, a kind of lingering, dreamy eloquence. Golf, John Updike wrote, is of all games ‘the most mystical, the least earthbound, the one wherein the wall between us and the supernatural...
fullContent: Golf lends itself to spectacle. There’s a special thrill to the shape of the perfectly hit shot, a kind of lingering, dreamy eloquence. Golf, John Updike wrote, is of all games ‘the most mystical, the least earthbound, the one wherein the wall between us and the supernatural is rubbed thinnest’.

title: Huw Lemmey: Short Cuts
summary: I believe there is a moral case for disarming the machinery of war that is killing innocent civilians in Gaza with the complicity of the British government. I believe that damaging and destroying weapons of war is one way of waging peace: I can only conclude that for the...
fullContent: I believe there is a moral case for disarming the machinery of war that is killing innocent civilians in Gaza with the complicity of the British government. I believe that damaging and destroying weapons of war is one way of waging peace: I can only conclude that for the British government, the waging of peace is terrorism.

title: Colin Burrow: Let custards quake
summary: To think of a satirist as a person who angrily turns against a gale-force wind and sprays liquefied shit at a group of constantly multiplying targets would not be entirely wrong. The truly misanthropic, universally and riotously angry satirist can perform acts of harm which...
fullContent: To think of a satirist as a person who angrily turns against a gale-force wind and sprays liquefied shit at a group of constantly multiplying targets would not be entirely wrong. The truly misanthropic, universally and riotously angry satirist can perform acts of harm which are also acts of self-harm, as their imagination fires itself up with a disgust that is also a form of self-disgust.

title: Adam Shatz: The World since 7 October
summary: The inability of Western powers to condemn Israel’s conduct – much less bring it to an end – has made a mockery of the rules-based order that they claim to uphold.
fullContent: The inability of Western powers to condemn Israel’s conduct – much less bring it to an end – has made a mockery of the rules-based order that they claim to uphold.

title: Barbara Everett: An East Wind behind it
summary: For many years, if asked about Hamlet’s poetic quality, I would have quoted not ‘To be, or not to be’ (which strikes me as grossly overrated in its importance), but Polonius’s casual words to the king: ‘You know sometimes he walks four hours together/Here in the lobby.
fullContent: For many years, if asked about Hamlet’s poetic quality, I would have quoted not ‘To be, or not to be’ (which strikes me as grossly overrated in its importance), but Polonius’s casual words to the king: ‘You know sometimes he walks four hours together/Here in the lobby.’ What exquisite memories of the pure tedium of teenagers’ lives this brings back!

title: Nicole Flattery: Priests are human too
summary: Tech autocrats have nothing on the curtain twitchers of Irish villages. In The Pilgrimage, John Broderick writes that ‘the city dweller who passes through a country town and imagines it as sleepy and apathetic is very far from the truth: it is as watchful as the jungle.’...
fullContent: Tech autocrats have nothing on the curtain twitchers of Irish villages. In The Pilgrimage, John Broderick writes that ‘the city dweller who passes through a country town and imagines it as sleepy and apathetic is very far from the truth: it is as watchful as the jungle.’

title: Anthony Grafton: No Cheese Please
summary: The library made possible a new kind of intellectual life. Machiavelli, when he’d been exiled from Florence, described a later version of this life in a splendidly ironic letter to Francesco Vettori: in the morning, he read one of the poets while seated by a spring; in the...
fullContent: The library made possible a new kind of intellectual life. Machiavelli, when he’d been exiled from Florence, described a later version of this life in a splendidly ironic letter to Francesco Vettori: in the morning, he read one of the poets while seated by a spring; in the afternoon, he killed time with his neighbours at the tavern; at night, he conversed with the ancients in his study.

title: Anna McGee: In Florence
summary: Orsanmichele market had many features of the pre-electronic exchange model, with its standardised measures and pricing, set hours and regulatory oversight, and the beginning and end of trading each day was even marked by the ringing of a bell.
fullContent: Orsanmichele market had many features of the pre-electronic exchange model, with its standardised measures and pricing, set hours and regulatory oversight, and the beginning and end of trading each day was even marked by the ringing of a bell. But the New York Stock Exchange doesn’t have an image of the Virgin Mary painted on the wall. The painting in Orsanmichele appeared overnight, out of nowhere, shortly after construction finished in 1290.

title: Vincent Brown: What Universities Owe
summary: When challenged to justify past investment in slavery – or current investments in, say, fossil fuel extraction or arms manufacture – officials weigh the costs and benefits of potential reforms. In the wrong hands, the internal review or study can be little more than a PR...
fullContent: When challenged to justify past investment in slavery – or current investments in, say, fossil fuel extraction or arms manufacture – officials weigh the costs and benefits of potential reforms. In the wrong hands, the internal review or study can be little more than a PR exercise, allowing the institution to acknowledge past wrongs while sidestepping accountability. In Yale and Slavery, David W. Blight will have none of this.

title: Jonathan Parry: Every Mother’s Son
summary: In The Four Feathers, Fevershams have populated the army for generations because they are ‘first-class fighting men’, but ‘rather stupid’. Willoughby, one of the feather-givers, also has ‘an aspect of invincible stupidity’.
fullContent: In The Four Feathers, Fevershams have populated the army for generations because they are ‘first-class fighting men’, but ‘rather stupid’. Willoughby, one of the feather-givers, also has ‘an aspect of invincible stupidity’. The British Army had always relied on such men’s unquestioning obedience. Too many women, like Harry’s fiancée, Ethne, admire ‘brute courage’ in a man.

title: Jon Day: The Beautiful Ones
summary: Those who keep them as pets know them to be clean, gregarious creatures with a highly developed social life, but for most of us rats inspire only revulsion. This might be one reason they have become such popular subjects for scientific experiments, it being easier to sacrifice...
fullContent: Those who keep them as pets know them to be clean, gregarious creatures with a highly developed social life, but for most of us rats inspire only revulsion. This might be one reason they have become such popular subjects for scientific experiments, it being easier to sacrifice animals to the pursuit of knowledge if you’re not particularly fond of them in the first place.

title: Stephen Buranyi: Folding and Unfolding
summary: How and why do proteins, which are produced by our body to build structures (such as skin and muscle) or carry out tasks (like breaking down our food), abandon their set roles and develop a new one?
fullContent: How and why do proteins, which are produced by our body to build structures (such as skin and muscle) or carry out tasks (like breaking down our food), abandon their set roles and develop a new one? Unlike other proteins, prions can gain the ability to replicate, causing damage as they spread; they can jump between bodies, and sometimes even between species.

title: Eleanor Nairne: At the Whitney
summary: Alice Neel liked to say that she painted all of a person: ‘What the world has done to them and their retaliation’. The opposite might be said of Amy Sherald: she seems less concerned with the bruised interior than with the exterior shell we create under duress.
fullContent: Alice Neel liked to say that she painted all of a person: ‘What the world has done to them and their retaliation’. The opposite might be said of Amy Sherald: she seems less concerned with the bruised interior than with the exterior shell we create under duress.

title: Becca Rothfeld: Whatevership
summary: Philip Roth and David Foster Wallace come to mind as antecedents, though Tulathimutte has their wit without their warmth. He writes like a child holding a microscope over the ground, peering down at an insect burning to death.
fullContent: Philip Roth and David Foster Wallace come to mind as antecedents, though Tulathimutte has their wit without their warmth. He writes like a child holding a microscope over the ground, peering down at an insect burning to death.

title: Michael Wood: At the Movies
summary: 28 Years Later is compelling to watch, even if we can’t like much of what we see. We can’t answer the questions it asks and we can’t hide from it in allegory. But we could perhaps prepare ourselves a little for a time when the virus of rage finds too many friends.
fullContent: 28 Years Later is compelling to watch, even if we can’t like much of what we see. We can’t answer the questions it asks and we can’t hide from it in allegory. But we could perhaps prepare ourselves a little for a time when the virus of rage finds too many friends.

title: Ange Mlinko: Morbid Symptoms
summary: A lot of contradictions are laid out in Michelle de Kretser’s Theory and Practice, and one’s tolerance for graduate students – clearly infantilised by their milieu, despite being in their mid-twenties – may be sorely tested.
fullContent: A lot of contradictions are laid out in Michelle de Kretser’s Theory and Practice, and one’s tolerance for graduate students – clearly infantilised by their milieu, despite being in their mid-twenties – may be sorely tested. Is this a novel of ideas, or a novel about people who like to talk about ideas? I suspect the latter.

title: Gazelle Mba: Diary
summary: Alau Dam, twenty kilometres to the south of Maiduguri, the capital of the northeastern Nigerian state of Borno, collapsed on the morning of 10 September last year. Nearly half a million people were displaced and, though the death toll hasn’t been formally established, it was...
fullContent: Alau Dam, twenty kilometres to the south of Maiduguri, the capital of the northeastern Nigerian state of Borno, collapsed on the morning of 10 September last year. Nearly half a million people were displaced and, though the death toll hasn’t been formally established, it was in the hundreds, possibly as many as a thousand.

title: DP20449 Evaluating Experimental Designs
summary: This introductory chapter outlines key criteria for evaluating experimental measures, and connects these criteria to the selection of experimental parameters across various contexts. We aim for this chapter to serve as a framework for assessing the different measures,...

title: DP20448 Decomposing First-Mover Advantage: A Decision-Making Perspective
summary: We develop a theory of first-mover advantage (FMA) grounded in decision-making ability and error propensity. Our simulation model demonstrates how small initial advantages compound through systematic differences in error rates between first- and second-movers.
